cities.name: Warsaw
cities.description: The capital and largest city of Poland, known for its historical Old Town and vibrant culture.

cities.name: Kraków
cities.description: A historic city in southern Poland, known for its well-preserved medieval core and Jewish quarter.

cities.name: Gdańsk
cities.description: A port city on the Baltic coast, known for its historical architecture and shipbuilding industry.

cities.name: Wrocław
cities.description: A city on the Oder River in western Poland, known for its beautiful town square and vibrant cultural scene.

cities.name: Poznań
cities.description: One of the oldest and largest cities in Poland, known for its renaissance-style buildings and historical landmarks.

cities.name: Łódź
cities.description: A city in central Poland, known for its 19th-century architecture and thriving arts community.

cities.name: Lublin
cities.description: A city in eastern Poland, known for its historical Old Town and rich cultural heritage.

cities.name: Szczecin
cities.description: A port city in northwestern Poland, known for its maritime industry and historical buildings.

cities.name: Katowice
cities.description: A city in southern Poland, known for its industrial history and modern cultural venues.

cities.name: Białystok
cities.description: A city in northeastern Poland, known for its diverse cultural influences and beautiful parks.
